name: The Secret Ingredient (Wasabi): Wasabi-Battered Calamari with Wasabi Mayo
description: Note: This month Kerry's secret ingredient is wasabi. These recipes should get your mouth's attention! [Photographs: Kerry Saretsky] In my family, we have a long-standing sushi tradition. It goes something like this: I drive to the supermarket where they roll...
recipeIngredient: 1/2 pound calamari tubes, sliced into 1/4-inch rings
Note: You can easily make the Wasabi Mayonnaise hotter by changing the proportion of olive oil and wasabi oil. I purchased the wasabi oil at Whole Foods in the fish section.

recipeInstructions.text: Fill a cast iron skillet halfway up with vegetable oil, and heat to 375°F.
Toss the calamari rings with the flour and wasabi powder in a large baggie. Dump the contents of the baggie into a large-mesh sieve, and shake off the excess.
Fry the calamari in 3 batches for just 1 to 1 1/2 minutes. Drain on paper towel, and sprinkle with salt. Serve with the Wasabi Mayonnaise and lime wedges.
